VLIB Function Reference

Homography Decomposition

Introduction and Use Cases

Homography decomposition involves decomposing a homography matrix into its translation vector, projection vector, and rotation matrix.

Specification

Function

This function uses the Faugeras method to compute the projection vector, translation vector, and rotation matrix from the homography matrix. The Faugeras method uses SVD. Since the homography is a 3x3 matrix, an optimized SVD targeted for a 3x3 matrix was utilized.

Inputs


    Parameter          Description
    --------------------------------------------------------
    H[][]              3x3 Homography matrix        (double)
    rot[][]            3x3 Rotation matrix          (double)
    trans[]            3x1 Translation vector       (double)
    proj[]             3x1 Projection vector        (double)

APIS

  • VLIB_homographyDecomposition

References

  1. O. Faugeras and F. Lustman. Motion and structure from motion in a piecewise planar environment. Int. Journal of Pattern Recognition and Artificial Intelligence, 2(3):485-508, 1988.
